questions.question: What is the minimum grade level for which a Contract Appointment shall be made?
options: SGL. 07
SGL. 08
SGL. 10
SGL. 12
questions.explanation: The Post to which contract appointment shall be made must not be below SGL. 12.

questions.question: The duration of a contract appointment should be one (1) or two (2) years and renewable but must not exceed what maximum period in total?
options: Two years
Three years
Four years
Six years
questions.explanation: The duration of contract appointment should be one (1) or two (2) years and renewable but not more than four (4) years in all.

questions.question: What mandatory duty must a **Contract Officer** undertake as a condition for their offer of appointment?
options: Mentoring serving Officers
Obtaining foreign exchange
Serving in a Parastatal only
Working only from home
questions.explanation: The contract Officer must, as part of his duties, be responsible for mentoring serving Officers as a condition for the offer of the contract appointment.

questions.question: Where retired officers are re-engaged into career posts, on what grade level shall their appointment be made?
options: The grade level immediately above their retirement level
The grade level immediately below that on which they retired
SGL 17 only
GL 08 only
questions.explanation: Where retired Officers from the Service are re-engaged into career posts, the appointment shall be on grade level immediately below that on which they retired and be eligible to maintain their last step at retirement.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of times a Trade Union/Staff Association Executive member is mandated to serve in their tenure in the Public Service?
options: One term
Two terms
Three terms
Four terms
questions.explanation: Trade Unions/Staff Associations are mandated to introduce tenure limit of two (2) terms in their Constitutions.

questions.question: An Officer who resigns is liable to forfeit all claims to:
options: Their pension benefits
Salary only
Vacation leave and any vacation leave or passage privileges granted
Health Insurance
questions.explanation: An Officer who resigns will be liable to forfeit all claims to vacation leave and any vacation leave or passage privileges granted.

questions.question: The PSR shall be reviewed how frequently to reflect current realities and align with global best practices?
options: Annually
Every three years
Every five years
After every election cycle
questions.explanation: The Public Service Rules (PSR) shall be reviewed every five years to update the provisions of the rules.

questions.question: What process replaces the Annual Performance Evaluation Report (APER) for the Federal Public Service?
options: IPPIS
The Performance Management System (PMS)
The Scheme of Service
Staff Inspection
questions.explanation: The Performance Management System (PMS) shall replace the Annual Performance Evaluation Report (APER) for the Federal Public Service.

questions.question: What is the primary rationale for implementing virtual meetings/engagements in the Public Service?
options: To reduce travel costs only
To enhance political activities
To respond to work demands remotely and ensure continuity during pandemics/emergencies
To eliminate the need for physical offices
questions.explanation: The rationale is to ensure that employees are able to respond to work demands remotely, such that MDAs continue to function adequately with minimal disruption in the face of any pandemic/emergencies.

questions.question: The Confirmation Examination Board is chaired by whom?
options: Director (Promotion) FCSC
Director (HRM) Federal Ministry of Justice
Permanent Secretary, CMO (OHCSF)
Permanent Secretary, Federal Civil Service Commission
questions.explanation: The Examination Board shall be responsible for the conduct and supervision of the examinations. The Board shall comprise the Permanent Secretary, CMO (OHCSF) as Chairman.

questions.question: How long after first appointment must officers eligible for compulsory confirmation examination have served before taking the exam?
options: Three months
Six months
One year
Two years
questions.explanation: Newly recruited Officer who has spent six months and above shall be allowed to sit for compulsory examination for confirmation in the Service.

questions.question: What is the consequence for an officer who fails the compulsory confirmation examination after three consecutive attempts?
options: Promotion deferment
Required to resign or withdraw from the service
Transfer to a Parastatal
Granting of paid leave
questions.explanation: An Officer who fails the examination after three consecutive attempts shall by virtue of such failures be required to resign or withdraw from the service.

questions.question: What category of appointments were introduced to fill observed gaps and/or shore up the capacities of existing Officers, specifically covering Contract, Internship, and Volunteerism?
options: Trainee Appointments
Non-Pensionable Appointments
Short Term Appointments
Ad-hoc Appointments
questions.explanation: Appointments may be made for a prescribed period of time in the following categories: Contract Appointments, Sabbatical Appointment, Career Exchange Programme, Talent Sourcing Strategy, Internship and Volunteerism in the Federal Service.

questions.question: What is the PSR‚Äôs definition of **Internship**?
options: A temporary assignment abroad
A non-structured, unpaid role
A structured experience that relates to a student‚Äôs/graduate‚Äôs discipline or career goal and helps to enhance academic, career, professional and personal development
A role for retired officers only
questions.explanation: Internship connotes a structured experience that relates to a student‚Äôs/graduate‚Äôs discipline or career goal and helps to enhance academic, career, professional and personal development.

questions.question: What is the maximum continuous service period for which a Secondment may be granted to the service of another approved body or international organization?
options: Two years (in the first instance)
Three years
Five years
Six years
questions.explanation: Secondment means the temporary release of an Officer to the service of another government approved body or any recognized International Organization or body for a **specified period**.

questions.question: What grade level must an officer be on to be eligible for Sabbatical Appointment?
options: GL 12 and above
GL 14 and above
GL 15 or equivalent and above
GL 08 and above
questions.explanation: Sabbatical Appointment applies to the Service is the appointment of an officer on GL 15 or equivalent and above.

questions.question: What is the mandatory retirement age for all grades in the Service?
options: 60 years or 35 years of pensionable service, whichever is earlier
65 years or 40 years of service
60 years only
35 years of service only
questions.explanation: The mandatory retirement age for all grades in the Service shall be 60 years or 35 years of pensionable service whichever is earlier.

questions.question: What is the consequence of making a false statement on the employment application, if detected after engagement?
options: Withholding of increment
Transfer to a new post
Regarded as sufficient grounds for non-employment or for subsequent termination of appointment without notice
Reprimand
questions.explanation: Concealment of any of the facts... or any false statement... shall be regarded as sufficient grounds for non-employment or for subsequent termination of appointment without notice.

questions.question: What is the primary objective of issuing a **Certificate of Service** to an officer leaving the service?
options: To grant retirement benefits
To serve as a reference covering the holder's public service when seeking other employment
To exempt the officer from tax
To authorize paid leave
questions.explanation: The main purpose of issuing a Certificate of Service is that, it may be used as a reference, covering the holder's public service when seeking other employment.

questions.question: What must an officer submit upon return from annual leave to their Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office?
options: Medical report
Progress report
Resumption of Duty Certificate (Form L.10)
A letter of thanks
questions.explanation: On return from annual leave, every Officer must complete and submit a Resumption of Duty Certificate (Form L.10).

questions.question: In the context of the PSR, what does the term 'Junior Posts' refer to?
options: Posts attracting emoluments on Grade Level 07 and above
Posts attracting emoluments on Grade Level 06 and below
Posts for temporary staff only
Posts in Parastatals only
questions.explanation: Junior Posts are posts in Ministries/Extra-Ministerial Offices attracting emoluments on Grade Level 06 and below.

questions.question: What is the entitlement for **Annual Leave** for officers on GL 07 and above?
options: 14 working days
21 working days
30 working days
45 calendar days
questions.explanation: Annual Leave entitlement for GL 07 and above is 30 working days.

questions.question: What action is required before any officer can withdraw their public record, such as personal files?
options: Verbal permission from the Permanent Secretary
Permission from the Permanent Secretary, Service Policies and Strategies Office, OHCSF
A police report
Approval from the FCSC
questions.explanation: No Officer may leave the Public Service take with him any public record without the written permission of the Permanent Secretary, Service Policies and Strategies Office, OHCSF.

questions.question: Who must approve the deployment of staff in the Nigerian Civil Service?
options: The Minister of Communications
The Federal Civil Service Commission
The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The National Assembly
questions.explanation: Appointments to offices in the Federal Civil Service are made on the authority of the Federal Civil Service Commission. Permanent Secretaries/Heads of Extra-Ministerial Offices are authorized to appoint candidates where powers have been delegated.

questions.question: The PSR permits officers to publish or speak in public or broadcast on any matter which may reasonably be regarded as:
options: A political or administrative nature, without permission
A personal affair, without permission
A political or administrative nature, only with express permission of their Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office
Official secrets
questions.explanation: No Officer shall, without the express permission of his Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office, speak in public or broadcast on any matter which may reasonably be regarded as of a political or administrative nature.

questions.question: Under the Performance Management System (PMS), performance expectations shall be based on the detailed contents captured in which document?
options: The National Budget
Job Descriptions (JDs)
The Leave Roster
The Reward and Recognition Scheme (R&RS)
questions.explanation: Job Descriptions (JDs) shall be available for each job, and used to capture detailed job contents including scope, responsibilities, reporting lines, etc. Performance expectations shall be based on the contents of JD.

questions.question: The PSR includes emerging issues such as Performance Management, Talent Sourcing, Volunteerism, and what other ICT-related trend?
options: Biometric Verification
Virtual Meetings/Engagements
Cloud Storage Policy
Electronic Mail Only Policy
questions.explanation: The 2021 Edition of Public Service Rules (PSR) includes emerging issues such as Performance Management System, Talent Sourcing, Volunteerism, Virtual Meetings/Engagements.

questions.question: When can an officer on leave be recalled by the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office?
options: Only on weekends
If they are required to return before the expiration of their authorized leave
If the officer is abroad
Only if they are GL 07 and above
questions.explanation: An Officer may be required to return to duty before the expiration of his authorized leave by the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office.

questions.question: The promotion process for officers involves a selection process including but not limited to written examination, oral interview, and what other technical assessment?
options: Financial audit
Test of ICT proficiency
Physical fitness test
Psychological evaluation
questions.explanation: Selection shall be through competitive examination process including but not limited to written examination, test of ICT proficiency and oral interview.

questions.question: When an Officer is promoted, when shall the payment of promotion arrears be made?
options: After six months
Within the year promotion is effected
Upon retirement
Immediately the letter is issued
questions.explanation: Payment of promotion arrears shall be made within the year promotion is effected.

questions.question: What is the maximum tenure for a Director, subject to satisfactory performance, under the Tenure Policy?
options: Four years renewable for a further four years
Five years renewable
Ten years non-renewable
Six years total
questions.explanation: A Director... shall compulsively retire upon serving eight years on the post; and a Permanent Secretary shall hold office for a term of four years and renewable for a further term of four years. (The Director rule mentions 8 years, while the PS rule mentions 4+4 years).

questions.question: What is the minimum number of years an officer on GL.07‚Äì14 must spend in post before being considered eligible for promotion?
options: 2 years
3 years
4 years
5 years
questions.explanation: The minimum number of years that an Officer must spend in a post before being considered eligible for promotion for GL.07‚Äì14 is Minimum of 3 years.

questions.question: What is the maximum period of continuous absence from duty without leave that makes an officer liable to dismissal (deemed to have resigned)?
options: 7 days
10 days
14 days
30 days
questions.explanation: An Officer absent without Leave for 14 days renders himself liable to dismissal.

questions.question: Who must countersign the Certificate of Service issued to an officer holding senior posts (GL 07 and above)?
options: The Minister
The Permanent Secretary of the retiring Officer and the Permanent Secretary, Federal Civil Service Commission
The Director HRM only
The Accountant General
questions.explanation: Certificate of service to be issued to Officers holding senior posts on GL.07 and above, requires the countersignature of the Permanent Secretary of the retiring Officer and the Permanent Secretary, Federal Civil Service Commission.

questions.question: Which specific allowance is not payable if the transfer is at the Officer's own request?
options: Duty Tour Allowance
Kilometer Allowance
Resettlement Allowance
Shift Duty Allowance
questions.explanation: An Officer whose transfer is at his own request shall be entitled to only transport allowance and not resettlement allowance.

questions.question: What is the rate of payment for **Resettlement Allowance**?
options: 5 per cent of annual emolument
2 per cent of an Officer's annual total emolument
10 per cent of monthly salary
A fixed amount of N50,000
questions.explanation: Resettlement Allowance shall be paid at the rate of 2 per cent of an Officer‚Äôs annual total emolument.

questions.question: Who shall be paid the **Non-accident bonus** at the rate of N50,000.00 per annum?
options: All officers who drive government vehicles
Drivers who are not involved in an accident and have been driving for a period of not less than six months in a year
All senior officers
Only drivers of Ministers
questions.explanation: Non-accident bonus shall be paid at the rate of N50,000.00 per annum, for drivers who are not involved in an accident... and have been driving for a period of not less than six months in a year.

questions.question: Which form of reward includes certificates, engraved plaques, medals, cash gifts, and sponsorship for attendance of Masterclass and local training programmes?
options: Acting Allowance
Resettlement Allowance
Reward for Outstanding Work and Meritorious Service
Duty Tour Allowance
questions.explanation: Rewards for each of the awards shall be in the form of certificates, letter of recommendation, engraved plaques or trophies, medals, cash gifts, sponsorship....

questions.question: What is the primary objective of staff development policies?
options: To promote only senior staff
To enhance the knowledge, skills, attitude, effectiveness and efficiency of staff
To reduce the workforce
To replace permanent staff with contract staff
questions.explanation: Objectives of Staff Development... to enhance the knowledge, skills, attitude, effectiveness and efficiency of staff.

questions.question: Under the **Performance Management Cycle**, when shall individual performance planning be done?
options: At the end of the year
Mid-year
At the beginning of the Performance Management Cycle
Only when the officer requests it
questions.explanation: Individual Performance Planning shall be done at the beginning of the Performance Management Cycle.

questions.question: Which PSR rule prohibits officers from borrowing money in any manner that places them under a financial obligation to a person within the Public Service?
options: Rule 100427 (Seeking Influence)
Rule 100432 (Borrowing Money)
Rule 100416 (Unauthorized Disclosure)
Rule 100424 (Investments)
questions.explanation: No Officer may borrow money either as principal or as surety or in any manner which places him under a financial obligation to a person within the Public Service.

questions.question: What is the entitlement for **Annual Leave** for officers on GL 04‚Äì06?
options: 14 working days
21 working days
30 working days
45 calendar days
questions.explanation: Annual Leave entitlement for GL 04‚Äì06 is 21 working days.

questions.question: What is the compensation for an officer who sustains an injury during official duties which incapacitates them, such that they are entitled to be discharged from sick leave or permanently invalided?
options: Entitled to draw full emolument until he is discharged
Payment of half salary
Immediate dismissal
Transfer to a desk job
questions.explanation: An Officer who is incapacitated as a result of injury sustained in the course of his official duties shall be entitled to draw full emolument until he is discharged from sick leave or permanently invalided.

questions.question: What does the PSR state must be done with all records generated during any of the phases of the annual Performance Management cycle?
options: Destroyed immediately
Used only for public consultation
Administered in line with good administrative document and data management practices
Sent to the National Assembly
questions.explanation: All records generated during any of the phases of the annual Performance Management cycle... shall be administered in line with good administrative document and data management practices.

questions.question: What is the penalty for failure to submit required representations regarding unsatisfactory conduct within the specified time limit?
options: The representations are accepted late
Appropriate sanction will be invoked against the officer
The officer is transferred
The officer is promoted
questions.explanation: Failure to submit them within this time limit will be taken to mean that you do not wish to make any, and appropriate sanction will be invoked against you.

questions.question: Which authority is responsible for the approval of conditions of service, schemes of service, and organizational structure for Parastatals?
options: Supervising Minister
The Board/Council
The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
Federal Ministry of Finance
questions.explanation: Conditions of Service, Scheme of Service and the Organizational Structure for Parastatals shall be approved by the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation.

questions.question: What is the required qualification standard for **Interns and Volunteers**?
options: Primary School Certificate only
Secondary School Certificate Examination (SSCE) or equivalent, up to University Degree/HND
Masters Degree only
Only specialized professional certification
questions.explanation: Interns must be postgraduates, undergraduates, or students in other tertiary institutions while volunteers must possess a University Degree, HND, NCE, ND and SSCE or its equivalent.

questions.question: What is the minimum period of service required for an officer to qualify for Annual Leave in a given year?
options: Less than six months
Not less than six months previous service within a leave earning service year
One month
Twelve months
questions.explanation: An Officer shall qualify for Annual Leave not less than six months previous service within a leave earning service year.

questions.question: For a senior officer seeking a Certificate of Service (Form Gen. 58), whose countersignature is required in addition to the Permanent Secretary of the retiring officer?
options: The Auditor General
The Permanent Secretary, Federal Civil Service Commission
The Minister of Labour
The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
questions.explanation: Certificate of service to be issued to Officers holding senior posts on GL.07 and above, requires the countersignature of the Permanent Secretary of the retiring Officer and the Permanent Secretary, Federal Civil Service Commission.

Bypass review and approval controls to save time.
Prioritize convenience over policy and legal requirements.
Apply approved public service & institutional reforms procedures and maintain complete records.

questions.question: The Public Service Rules (PSR) apply to all officers except where specific terms in a contract or letter of appointment conflict with them. What must the PSR itself conform to?
options: Federal Ministry of Finance Guidelines
The Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria
Extant Circulars issued by the OHCSF
The Nigerian Foreign Service Regulations
questions.explanation: The Rules apply only to the extent that they are not inconsistent with the provisions of the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

questions.question: In the PSR rule numbering system, what do the first two digits indicate?
options: The Rule Number
The Section Number
The Chapter Number
The Year of Amendment
questions.explanation: Each Rule has been given a number containing six digits. The first two indicate the Chapter.

questions.question: Which body holds the authority for making appointments to posts graded GL.07‚Äì17 in the Federal Civil Service?
options: Permanent Secretaries of the respective MDAs
The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC)
The Junior Staff Committee (JSC)
questions.explanation: The Federal Civil Service Commission shall make appointments to posts graded GL.07-17.

questions.question: What is the consequence for an officer who changes their date of birth recorded upon appointment throughout their career?
options: Promotion deferment
Immediate retirement
Act of serious misconduct
Warning letter only
questions.explanation: Date of birth recorded on appointment by an officer shall not be changed throughout the career of the Officer. Any contravention shall be regarded as an act of serious misconduct.

questions.question: What is the deadline for the submission of applications from interested candidates following a recruitment advertisement by the FCSC?
options: Two weeks
One month
Six weeks
Three months
questions.explanation: The deadline for submission of applications from interested candidates shall be six weeks from the date of placement of the advertisement.

questions.question: Which officer category is handled by the Junior Staff Committee (JSC) of each Ministry/Office regarding appointments?
options: Senior Posts (GL 07 and above)
Junior Staff on GL. 06 and below
Contract Staff (SGL 12 and above)
Permanent Secretaries
questions.explanation: Each Ministry/Extra-Ministerial Office shall appoint Junior Staff on GL. 06 and below. This shall be handled by the Junior Staff Committee.

questions.question: What is the policy regarding the employment of unpaid staff in the Federal Public Service?
options: It is encouraged for internship programs
It is restricted to GL 01-03
It is prohibited
It requires ministerial approval
questions.explanation: The employment of unpaid Staff is prohibited.

questions.question: What standard rule applies when an Officer is promoted to a grade level that does not overlap their old grade level?
options: They are placed on the next point higher than the former emolument
They will be placed at the minimum point of their new salary grade level
Their increment is deferred for one year
They are required to take a competitive examination
questions.explanation: If the Officer is promoted to a grade level that does not overlap his old grade level, he will be placed at the minimum point of his new salary grade level.

questions.question: If an increment is deferred or withheld, can it be restored with retrospective effect in consequence of improved service during a later period?
options: Yes, if approved by the FCSC
Yes, immediately
No, increment is not restored retrospectively
Only for officers on GL 15 and above
questions.explanation: An increment deferred or withheld cannot be restored with retrospective effect in consequence of improved service during a later increment earning period [10-12].

questions.question: What term defines the temporary removal of an officer from performing his normal duties when disciplinary proceedings for dismissal are undertaken, and the officer is paid half salary?
options: Suspension
Demotion
Interdiction
Termination
questions.explanation: Interdiction means the temporary removal of an officer... during which he shall be placed on half salary.

questions.question: Who must approve the deployment of an officer to a duty station or department, referred to as 'Posting'?
options: The Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office
The Director HR
The FCSC
The Staff Union
questions.explanation: Posting is the initial assignment of an officer to position (job schedule). The Director HR submits reports on posting instructions.

questions.question: The PSR strongly advises that the posting system should not be used as a tool for:
options: Acquiring whole-service experience
Coercion, punishment, or cronyism
Filling critical gaps in specialized skills
Promoting high-priority service-wide projects
questions.explanation: Fairness to all Officers shall be an underlying principle in order to ensure that the system is not used as a tool for coercion, punishment or cronyism.

questions.question: An officer on an official assignment is entitled to airfare, depending on the exigencies and with the approval of whom?
options: The Permanent Secretary, CMO
The President
The Accounting Officer
The Director of Finance
questions.explanation: All Officers on official assignment are entitled to airfare, depending on the exigencies and with the approval of the Accounting Officer.

questions.question: Which allowance is payable to officers traveling to towns and cities where air transport services do not exist, based on distance?
options: Duty Tour Allowance (DTA)
Estacode Allowance
Kilometer Allowance
Transport and Local Running Allowance
questions.explanation: All Officers when travelling to towns and cities where air transport services do not exist shall be paid Kilometer Allowance.

questions.question: How much of their Duty Tour Allowance (DTA) are officers granted for the purpose of local running (transport and local errands)?
options: 10% of DTA
20% of DTA
30% of DTA
50% of DTA
questions.explanation: For the purpose of local running, Officers shall be granted 30% of their duty tour allowance in addition to airport taxi, at the prevailing rates.

questions.question: Who must provide security guidelines for all high-level intra and inter-governmental virtual meetings?
options: The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The Federal Ministry of Communications and Digital Economy
The Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC)
The National Assembly
questions.explanation: Security of Government data/information... shall be conducted in line with the Guidelines prescribed from time to time by the Federal Ministry of Communications and Digital Economy.

questions.question: What is strictly prohibited for participants during virtual meetings, especially high-level engagements?
options: Use of mute technology
Sidebar conversations and multi-tasking
Observing short breaks
Identifying themselves when they speak
questions.explanation: No sidebar conversations and No multi-tasking (e.g., running e-mail or treating files while participating in virtual meetings).

questions.question: Which category of allowances is NOT explicitly listed in Chapter 14 of the PSR?
options: Warm Clothing Allowance
Books Allowance
Paternity Allowance
Kilometer Allowance
questions.explanation: Paternity Allowance is not explicitly listed in Rule 140102, which lists Acting, Books, Call Duty, Disengagement, Duty Tour, Estacode, Hazard, Kilometer, Overtime, Resettlement, etc. (Paternity Leave is a time entitlement, not a cash allowance listed here).

questions.question: What must officers do with historical manuscripts or other documents of public interest discovered in the course of their official duties?
options: Appropriate them for their own use
Report their existence to the Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra Ministerial Office for preservation
Sell them to private collectors
Publish them immediately
questions.explanation: Historical manuscripts... shall not be appropriated to his own use, but their existence must be reported to Permanent Secretary/ Head of Extra Ministerial Office in order that steps may be taken for their examination and preservation.

questions.question: Which authority is delegated full disciplinary powers over officers on Salary GL. 13 and below, with the exception of dismissal?
options: The FCSC
The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation
Permanent Secretaries and Heads of Extra-Ministerial Offices
The Minister
questions.explanation: The Federal Civil Service Commission has delegated full disciplinary powers to Permanent Secretaries and Heads of Extra-Ministerial Offices in respect of officers on Salary G.L. 13 and below with the exception of the power of dismissal which has been delegated only from G.L. 06 and below.

questions.question: What is the consequence of abstracting or copying official documents without special permission?
options: Reprimand
Abstraction or copying is prohibited and requires special permission of his Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra Ministerial Office
Minor misconduct
Transfer to a new posting
questions.explanation: Every Officer is prohibited from abstracting or copying official minutes, records or other documents except in accordance with official routine or with special permission of his Permanent Secretary/Head of Extra-Ministerial Office.

questions.question: An appeal made by an aggrieved officer for reconsideration of a decision must be handled and concluded within what maximum period?
options: 90 days
One year
Six months
18 months
questions.explanation: An appeal from an aggrieved Officer shall be handled and concluded within six months.

questions.question: What is the penalty for an officer who accepts a paid appointment during leave of absence without prior approval?
options: The officer shall not accept paid employment without the express permission of the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
Warning
Payment of a fine
Withheld increment
questions.explanation: An Officer on leave of absence shall not accept any paid employment without previously obtaining the express approval of the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF).

questions.question: What rule applies to an officer who finds valuable minerals or makes a discovery during their official duties?
options: They must give 10% to the Government
They must give full information to Government under pain of dismissal
They may sell the information privately
They must keep it a secret
questions.explanation: It is the duty of every Officer to report to Government any discovery of what he considers to be valuable minerals. Officers are prohibited, under pain of dismissal, from giving any information on such valuable discoveries to any syndicate, company or individual.

questions.question: What is the definition of **Suspension** in the PSR?
options: Removal of an Officer from performing the duties of his office, with half salary
Temporary removal from office, with full salary
Removal of an Officer from performing the duties of his office, during which period he shall earn no salary
A temporary transfer to a non-sensitive post
questions.explanation: Suspension means removal of an Officer from performing the duties of his office... during which period he shall earn no salary.

questions.question: What are **Senior Posts** defined as in the PSR?
options: Posts attracting emoluments on Grade Level GL 06 and below
Posts attracting emoluments on Grade Level GL 07 and above
All posts requiring a university degree
Directorate Cadres only
questions.explanation: Senior Posts are posts attracting emoluments on Grade Level GL.07 and above.

questions.question: What is the basis upon which an officer is considered for an award or recognition under the Reward and Recognition Scheme (R&RS)?
options: Seniority only
Political connection
Outstanding performance of duties and exemplary conduct
Attaining retirement age
questions.explanation: The recipient of any of the awards must have been considered as the best on the basis of outstanding performance of duties and exemplary conduct as outlined in approved Rewards and Recognition Scheme (R&RS).

questions.question: Which body is responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of the Performance Management System (PMS) across all levels of officers in a Federal Public Service Institution?
options: The FCSC
The Accounting Officer
The Director HRM
The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
questions.explanation: The Accounting Officer of every Federal Public Service Institution shall be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of the PMS across all levels of officers.

questions.question: When an officer is seconded to another Ministry/Extra Ministerial Office, who is responsible for furnishing the performance reports on that officer?
options: The Permanent Secretary of the original Ministry
The Permanent Secretary/Head of the Extra-Ministerial Office to which he is seconded
The OHCSF
The FCSC
questions.explanation: When an Officer is seconded to another Ministry/Extra Ministerial Office, the Permanent Secretary/Head of the Extra-Ministerial Office to which he is seconded is responsible for furnishing the reports on the Officer.

questions.question: The final Progress Report rendered on an officer after 21 months' service shall include a definite recommendation on which of the following outcomes?
options: Transfer or secondment only
Whether the appointment should be confirmed, terminated, or the contract renewed
Promotion to the next grade level
Granting of Sabbatical Leave
questions.explanation: The final Progress Report rendered after 21 months' service shall include a definite recommendation as to whether the Officer's appointment should be confirmed or terminated or whether his contract should be renewed.

questions.question: When an Officer's increment has been withheld, the FCSC may grant one or more **special increments** at a subsequent incremental date to mitigate what?
options: The cost of living
The lasting effects of the withheld increment
The officer‚Äôs poor performance
The administrative fees
questions.explanation: The FCSC may at a subsequent incremental date grant one or more special increments having the effects of raising the salary of the Officer to or towards the level it would have reached if the previous withholding has not occurred.

questions.question: All decisions on deferment or withholding of increment and stoppage of salaries must be communicated to the officer concerned within what period?
options: Two weeks
One month
Six weeks
Three months
questions.explanation: All decisions on deferment or withholding of increment and stoppage of salaries shall be communicated... to the Officer concerned within two weeks.

questions.question: Under the **Official Secrets Act**, what is the definition of 'classified matter'?
options: Any information concerning foreign policy
Information or thing which, under any system of security classification, is not to be disclosed to the public and whose disclosure would be prejudicial to the security of Nigeria
Personal files of senior officers
Official minutes of board meetings
questions.explanation: ‚ÄòClassified matter‚Äô means any information or thing which, under any system of security classification, is not to be disclosed to the public and of which the disclosure to the public would be prejudicial to the security of Nigeria.

questions.question: What is the effect on promotion eligibility for officers who are currently falling within the field of selection but are under a disciplinary action?
options: They are automatically promoted
They shall be considered eligible after the conclusion of the disciplinary action
They shall be considered except those who are under disciplinary action
Their selection is deferred until the next cycle
questions.explanation: All Officers who fall within the field of selection for any promotion exercise shall be considered except those who are under disciplinary action.

questions.question: In assessing the merit of an officer for promotion, what records are taken into account, especially when candidates have equal potential?
options: Political affiliations
Senority and previous records of performance
Marital status
Grade Level of their spouse
questions.explanation: Seniority and previous records of performance will be taken into account in choosing between candidates with equal potential for promotion.

questions.question: Who must approve the Conditions of Service, Scheme of Service, and Organizational Structure for Parastatals?
options: The Parastatal Board/Council alone
The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC)
The Supervising Ministry
questions.explanation: Conditions of Service, Scheme of Service and the Organizational Structure for Parastatals shall be approved by the Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation, on the recommendation of the various Boards/ Councils.

questions.question: What is the ultimate penalty for **Serious Misconduct**?
options: Withholding of increment
Transfer
Dismissal
Reprimand
questions.explanation: The ultimate penalty for serious misconduct is dismissal.

questions.question: In cases of dismissal, what is forfeited by the officer, according to the PSR?
options: Only their salary for that month
All claims to retiring benefits, leave or transport grant
Only their house
Half of their pension
questions.explanation: The ultimate penalty for serious misconduct is dismissal. An Officer who is dismissed forfeits all claims to retiring benefits, leave or transport grant etc..

questions.question: In Parastatals, which committee handles appointments and discipline of officers on GL 06 and below?
options: Senior Staff Committee (SSC)
Junior Staff Committee (JSC)
Chief Executive Officer (CEO) only
Board/Council
questions.explanation: The Board/Council of a parastatal shall approve promotion in respect of Senior Staff... while the promotion in respect of junior staff shall be delegated to Chief Executive Officer of the Agency on the recommendation of Junior Staff Committee.

questions.question: Where an officer in a Parastatal wishes to make a representation to the Head of Government, the petition must route through the petitioner's superior officer, the Chief Executive Officer, the Board/Council, and whom?
options: The FCSC
The Supervising Ministry of the Organization
The State Governor
The National Assembly
questions.explanation: The petition shall route such representation through the proper departmental channels, namely, the petitioner's superior Officer; the Chief Executive Officer; the Board/Council and the Supervising Ministry of the Organization.

questions.question: What is the frequency of medical examination required for officers in service, subsequent to their initial compulsory examination?

Every two years
Every five years
Every ten years
questions.explanation: In every five (5) years, an Officer shall present himself to a recognized Healthcare Provider for examination to certify that the Officer is sound in health and fit to continue in Service.

questions.question: In the case of illness, an officer must notify their Ministry/Agency in writing or by any other means of communication, supported by which document?
options: Medical Report from a traditional healer
Only an Excuse Duty Certificate
Medical Certificate of Treatment duly authorized by an approved Healthcare Provider
A personal letter of apology
questions.explanation: Any prolonged absence from duty on ground of illness should be supported with... Medical Certificate of Treatment duly authorized by an approved Healthcare Provider.

questions.question: What is the maximum period for which an officer may be allowed Sick Leave on the certificate of an approved Healthcare Provider?
options: Six weeks
Three months in the first instance
Six months total
One year
questions.explanation: Sick leave for a period up to three months in the first instance may be allowed on the certificate of an approved Healthcare Provider to an Officer who is hospitalized.

questions.question: When a pensionable Officer dies in service, Government‚Äôs responsibility is limited to the payment of what percentage of the Officer‚Äôs total annual emolument to the family as burial expenses?
options: 50 per cent
75 per cent
100 per cent
150 per cent
questions.explanation: Government's responsibility shall be limited to payment of 100 per cent of the Officer's total annual emolument to the family as burial expenses.

questions.question: What does the PSR mandate regarding the **gender** of terms like 'Officer' and 'Staff'?
options: They are exclusively masculine
They are exclusively feminine
The provisions of the Rules apply equally to both genders
They depend on the Head of the MDA
questions.explanation: Notwithstanding that throughout the Public Service Rules the terms 'Officer' and 'Staff' are referred to in the masculine gender, the provisions of the Rules apply equally to both genders.

questions.question: When an invention by an officer relates entirely to the execution of their employment, the full controlling rights in the invention are deemed to belong to whom?
options: The Officer (inventor)
The Federal Government
The Patent Office
The Minister
questions.explanation: When an invention is in all respects alien to the employment of the Officer, he shall normally be granted the full rights in such invention. (Impliedly, rights belong to Government if related to employment).

questions.question: When an Officer is eligible for overtime payment, he will be paid overtime on his full emolument if he is in what status?
options: On Leave of Absence
In an acting appointment
Under suspension
On sabbatical leave
questions.explanation: When an Officer eligible for overtime payment is duly authorized to act in a post which attracts overtime payment, he will be paid for overtime on his full acting emolument.

questions.question: The PSR provides for the establishment of an **Inventions and Awards Committee** to perform which primary function?
options: Disciplinary hearings
Investigate and make recommendations in connection with inventions and commercial proceeds
Staff posting and transfer
Promotion interviews
questions.explanation: The functions of the Committee shall be to make investigations and recommendations in connection with Rules 150301 and 150302.

questions.question: Who must approve the deployment or payment of estacode allowance for Overseas Duty Tour by all public servants?
options: The Minister of Foreign Affairs
The Permanent Secretary/Head of the Extra-Ministerial Office only
The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF)
The FCSC
questions.explanation: Oversea Duty Tour by all public servants and estacode allowance shall be subject to the approval of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation, on the recommendation of the Permanent Secretary/Head of the Extra-Ministerial Office.

questions.question: What is the penalty if an officer fails to comply with instructions delivered to him at his address within seven days of being placed on **Interdiction**?
options: Warning
Payment of a fine
Deemed as absent from duty without leave
Temporary transfer
questions.explanation: If he fails to comply with the instructions delivered to him at such address within seven days of such delivery, he will be regarded as absent from duty without leave.
